DataElement.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood And Additive Quantity Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of the total volume of umbilical cord blood and additives in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood And Additive Total Quantity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Blood from the umbilical cord of a newborn baby. This blood contains high concentrations of stem cells (cells from which all blood cells develop)._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition_How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number. [Manually curated].

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics.

Concepts.definition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:Quantity; how much there is of something that you can measure.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:A number with no fractional part.::1:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
